Judy writes:
> I did some analysis on the 7-28-03 crawl and it looks like none of the 
> 3 crawlers are finding this javascript linked page: 
> jscriptOpenWindowArg.html 
> which is coming from http://crawl08.archive.org/links/javascript.html
> 
> httrack is finding the other javascript linked page:
> jscriptOpenWindow.html
> However, mercator and heritrix are not.

These are the kind of javascript links we'd like to get -- 
recognizable path-like single strings -- so this lack
is a bug; please file.

> Also, heritrix is getting robots.txt excluded pages & directories. 

Is it getting all excluded areas, or just some? If just some, is
there any pattern to those it gets and those it doesn't?

I see that there is still a bug in the EasyGarden robots.txt:
there should be only one "User-Agent: *" directive, with
mutliple "Disallow:"s after it. Could this be the issue?

> It's 
> also adding "%22" after some of the directories, for example,
> crawl08.archive.org/access/%22, which results in 404s, but it is getting 
> the correct URL crawl08.archive.org/access/.

%22 is the URI-encoding for double-quotes ("). I would normally
expect this might be triggered by an unmatched set of quotes,
like:

  <a href=/access">blah</a>

However, I can't find any such in the garden pages. Perhaps it's
a misparsing of the empty URIs inside /access/index.html:

  <a href=""></a>

It's a bug to be filed in any case, good catch.

- Gordon
